title: Hearse carrying coffin among 4 vehicles involved in accident on CTE; 3 taken to hospital
description: SINGAPORE — Three people were taken to hospital after an accident involving several vehicles, including a hearse carrying a coffin, occurred along the Central Expressway (CTE) in the late morning on Thursday (April 20).

title: ICA reviewing biometrics system upgrade processes following hours-long checkpoint delay that affected 85,000 travellers
description: SINGAPORE — Following a recent technical glitch which sparked hours-long delays and snaking queues at Singapore's checkpoints, the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA

title: 0.5% of private homes sold from 2018-2021 used 99:1 ownership arrangement allowing buyers to pay less tax
description: SINGAPORE — A "small but rising number" of private residential properties transacted involved a property purchase arrangement in which the ownership of a property is split in a 99:1 ratio, which would effectively reduce the additional buyer’s stamp duty (ABSD) needed, said Senior Minister of State for Finance

title: S'poreans buying costlier but fresher local produce will beef up country's future food security: Grace Fu
description: SINGAPORE — When Singaporeans buy homegrown produce, even if it costs more, they are "co-investing in the country's food resilience in the future", Ms Grace Fu said.

title: 'Unnecessary hassle': Buskers question need for yearly in-person audition, NAC calls it fair way to ensure quality acts
description: SINGAPORE — To renew his busking licence, 27-year-old Jonathan Goh shelled out almost S$2,000 on a flight back to Singapore from London to attend a five-minute-long audition.

title: Security guard, 74, left bleeding after assault by condo resident; third such case of abuse in 2 weeks
description: SINGAPORE — A 74-year-old security guard was left "injured and bleeding" after being assaulted by a condominium resident in Potong Pasir last week, the Union of Security Employees (USE) said.

title: Singapore halts import of live pigs from Pulau Bulan after African swine fever detected in carcasses
description: SINGAPORE — Singapore has stopped the import of live pigs from Pulau Bulan in Indonesia after African swine fever was detected in some pig carcasses.

title: Man pleads guilty to repeatedly harassing ex-lover, threatening to injure her teen son and drug offences
description: SINGAPORE — Unable to accept their breakup, a man harassed and stalked his ex-lover and her 13-year-old son, and even threatened to injure the teenager.

title: Jail for man who took 26 upskirt videos at MRT stations and on trains using hidden camera
description: SINGAPORE — He would place a camera facing up in a paper bag and put the bag on the floor of MRT cabins to take upskirt videos of women at various MRT stations in Singapore. He did this 19 times before he was eventually caught.

title: Ageing society: S'pore can cushion impact and 'even reap dividends' after decades of preparation, says Ong Ye Kung
description: SINGAPORE — The strong foundation Singapore has laid for an ageing society means that the nation is now in a position to cushion the impact of a greying population and perhaps “even reap the dividends” from it, Health Minister Ong Ye Kung said.

title: 35 arrested, 11kg of drugs seized in raids targeting transactions using encrypted chat apps
description: SINGAPORE — Thirty five suspected drug offenders have been arrested and more than 11kg of drugs seized in a series of island-wide operations from April 11 to 19 targeted at transactions conducted through encrypted chat applications.

title: Sevilla dump 'unacceptable' Man United out of Europa League
description: SEVILLE — Manchester United crashed out of the Europa League in shambolic fashion on Thursday (April 20) with Sevilla beating them 3-0, to reach the semi-finals 5-2 on aggregate.

title: BuzzFeed shutters news unit, cuts 15 per cent of staff
description: NEW YORK — BuzzFeed Inc said on Thursday (April 21) it will shutter its news division, which gained renown for its irreverent and probing coverage but ultimately succumbed to the challenges of its digital-first business model.

title: US rapper says M'sian fugitive Jho Low paid S$27 million for Obama photo, not campaign donation
description: WASHINGTON — Rapper Prakazrel "Pras Michel" of the Fugees, testifying in his own defense on Tuesday (April 18), said he received US$20 million (S$27 million) from Malaysian financier Jho Low to help him get a photo with former President Barack Obama.

title: Manslaughter charges against Alec Baldwin to be dropped
description: LOS ANGELES — Manslaughter charges against Alec Baldwin over a fatal shooting on a movie set are to be dropped, the prosecutor said Thursday (April 20), citing "new facts" that merit further investigation.

title: The Big Sort: Twitter ticks check out
description: LOS ANGELES — Elon Musk's long promised move to strip free blue ticks from Twitter users swung into action on Thursday (April 20), dividing the have-paids from the have-nots.

title: The Big Read in short: How can S’pore tackle vaping prevalence among youths?
description: SINGAPORE — When Henry first started using electronic vapourisers, or vapes, back in 2020, it was because it “seemed easier to hide” and “tasted better” than normal cigarettes.

title: Commentary: Travelling abroad? Don’t be tempted to pay your way using your home currency
description: Part of the joy of travelling comes from experiencing the unfamiliar – a different climate, culture or cuisine. But when it comes to paying for things abroad, we might feel more comfortable using the currency we are most familiar with, the one we use at home.

title: The Big Read: With vaping increasingly rampant among youths despite ban, what more can authorities do?
description: SINGAPORE — When Henry first started using electronic vapourisers, or vapes, back in 2020, it was because it “seemed easier to hide” and “tasted better” than normal cigarettes.

title: Commentary: Same moon, different dates for Hari Raya (again!)
description: The month of Ramadan, which falls on the ninth month in the Islamic lunar calendar, is coming to an end. Muslims around the world are preparing for Aidilfitri, which the Malays commonly refer to as Hari Raya (the big day) or what Indonesians would term as Lebaran (the end of fasting).

title: Commentary: Singapore’s the 25th happiest country in the world — here are some ways to make it a happier place
description: Almost every year since 2012, the World Happiness Report (WHR) has been documenting the rankings of national happiness for hundreds of countries worldwide.

title: Commentary: Why Singapore needs to move towards a meritocracy of skills and contributions
description: An educational meritocracy aims to reward on the basis of two ingredients: efforts and abilities.

title: Gen Y Speaks: I was a spoilt child who fumbled aimlessly through school. Getting back on my feet wasn’t easy
description: Growing up, I was very pampered by my family, especially being the youngest out of three siblings.

title: Gen Y Speaks: I didn’t do well in my first job. This is how I learnt not to beat myself up over it
description: I thought I was a hotshot. Yet I was rudely brought back down to Earth when in March 2021, my employer issued me with a performance improvement plan for various aspects of my work that the company was not satisfied with.

title: My Learning Diaries: My bosses’ decisions used to puzzle me. A 'FlexiMasters' course helped me see the light
description: The fast-changing nature of work has prompted many Singaporeans to upgrade their skills to stay relevant. TODAY’s Voices section is publishing first-hand accounts of young Singaporeans who have recently done so to give their careers a

title: Your Say: 3 ways to protect social workers from abuse and help them thrive
description: I refer to the article “Pay raise cold comfort for abuse that comes with job, say

title: My Learning Diaries: I’ve been paralysed from the waist down since 2018. That did not stop me from getting my degree in 2022
description: “Learning is not attained by chance; it must be sought with ardour and attended to with diligence.” I resonate with this quote by Abigail Adams — the first woman to serve as Second Lady of the United States — to never stop learning despite my medical condition.

title: Your Say: Mediation can be counterproductive for victims of workplace discrimination
description: The Ministry of Manpower (MOM)’s response to Aware’s recommendations on the upcoming workplace fairness legislation bears fu

title: Youth panels being set up for young S'poreans to suggest policy ideas that may be tabled in Parliament: Edwin Tong
description: SINGAPORE — To address a wish among youths to play a greater role in policy formulation by going beyond just dialogue and consultation, new youth-led panels to develop and recommend policies to the Government will be launched later this year. Their suggestions may be presented to Parliament.

title: Pics of Song Joong Ki in Rome with his pregnant wife Katy Louise Saunders
description: This is the first time Katy is seen with her baby bump.

title: 'Why spend S$7 at an atas bakery?' Ex-hotel chef sells S$1.50 madeleines and S$2.50 tarts at hawker stall
description: Fancy mini lemon meringue tarts and financiers are among the sought-after bakes at this Golden Mile Food Centre stall.

title: The IG-worthy Coach Play Singapore Shophouse has the first Coach Café in the world, immersive rooms and customisation services
description: Fancy shopping for a bag and feasting on IG-worthy desserts in a cute New York-style diner all under the same roof?

title: Lina Ng, who plays mum of bullying victim in upcoming drama, on why her son didn't tell her he was getting bullied back in primary school
description: The actress only realised something wasn't right when her son had a sudden emotional outburst.

title: 85 dead, hundreds injured in Yemen crowd crush over S$10.70 handout
description: SANAA (Yemen) — At least 85 people were killed and hundreds injured in a crush at a Ramadan cash handout in Yemen early on Thursday (April 20), as the impoverished country suffered one of its worst tragedies just as optimism was growing over its bitter civil war.

title: Les Amis Group’s Cluny Food Court at Botanic Gardens closes just over a year after launch
description: The multi-concept casual eatery quietly shut its doors last month.

title: Where New York drip meets Singapore hip: Coach comes out to play in a big way at Keong Saik Road
description: The American luxury brand’s first bespoke concept store in Asia – Coach Play Singapore Shophouse – boasts a retail space, cafe, vintage store and craftsmanship bar for customisation services.

title: How milk fuels you up for the challenges ahead
description: Being able to handle stress well, whether in school or at work, starts with having the right nutrition. Here’s how the new Meiji Multivitamin Milk can help supplement your diet.

title: To achieve FIRE, don’t rely on the spark of speculation
description: Financial independence and early retirement are popular goals for millennials and Gen Z workers – but getting there requires steady financial habits, not risky investments.

title: More than skin deep: Managing eczema and its symptoms
description: Regulating stress levels and using skin-friendly products can help bring relief to eczema-prone skin, say experts.

title: The right logistics partner: A game-changer in the ‘shoppertainment’ age
description: As more small businesses take to selling on entertainment platforms like TikTok, logistics provider J&T Express stands ready to deliver.
